column4: Hey everyone, I'm having some problems installing ubuntu onto my 'new' second-hand compaq armada m700 laptop
it can't read the breezy CD and it stalls during the Dapper installing
you prolly should try the alternative install cd Isyth
how does the livecd run on it Isyth ? slow?
the Breezy live CD doesn't run at all and the Dapper one is quite slow but working.
yeah I would use the etch alternative cd
you'll have a ncurses based install menu
if you can up to 256ram total it'll make a big difference
maybe that'll work. But what's that you said about the alternative install?
its where you dl the isos on the website
its made for systems with less than 192 of ram
that might do the trick. I'm having some problems opening the laptop to see where the ram goes... I'm not used to laptops.
